title: Pnpm config fields in project manifest
description: The configuration file for pnpm. The fields will be patched into the top level package.json of pnpm workspace created by Rush.js

$schema.description: Part of the JSON Schema standard, this optional keyword declares the URL of the schema that the file conforms to. Editors may download the schema and use it to perform syntax highlighting.

neverBuiltDependencies.description: This field allows to ignore the builds of specific dependencies. The "preinstall", "install", and "postinstall" scripts of the listed packages will not be executed during installation.

items.description: Specify package name of the dependency

overrides.description: This field allows you to instruct pnpm to override any dependency in the dependency graph. This is useful to enforce all your packages to use a single version of a dependency, backport a fix, or replace a dependency with a fork.

additionalProperties.description: You may specify the package the overriden dependency belongs to by separating the package selector from the dependency selector with a ">", for example qar@1>zoo will only override the zoo dependency of qar@1, not for any other dependencies.

packageExtensions.description: The packageExtensions fields offer a way to extend the existing package definitions with additional information.

additionalProperties.description: Specify the extension to a package
